Will Berkeley
Su Real Estate, amigos
Apr 7

Ticket

I’m going on broker tour today in the old hometown, Hingham. One of the strange things in my townie background is Tae Kwon Do. Hingham is intertwined with Tae Kwon Do for me. You can’t have one without the other. It was the problem. And the solution. It was the vehicle of my success. It was also a dark abyss. It completely derailed my life. It was very good and it was very bad. I was not the Karate Kid. I was this dark kid that took no prisoners. Tae Kwon Do is what I do. It’s your problem if you get in my way. You don’t jump in front of a gun. Don’t jump in front of me. I am a weapon. I also wasn’t afraid of a strong offense. I kicked a kid in the head in the Principal’s Office in front of my mother and his father. Then I threatened the father. That’s a fact that nobody can dispute. There were just too many witnesses. I also did it very casually. I was not even upset with anyone. I just wanted to shut the kid up. And make my point. I was way more dangerous than everyone in the room. The father also said he thought it was a good thing to start every day with a fight. I am the wrong person to suggest that too. And this is why. I had to sit down with the Superintendent of School on that one. He wanted me to apologize. I refused. You can’t make me do what all my martial arts coaches have been unable to do. I remain unbroken. Your move. Who talks like that? On the upside I was what you call a prodigy. That was something that actually got me off. My talent just could not be denied. I was a point of pride in the local papers. Hingham had some sort of vicious bird that was ripping up and down the East Coast. That was enough for most people. They liked that I won a lot of trophies. The case was often made that I should not be suspended because the kids I was fighting should know better. I was a national level martial artist. I also threw with real power. That somehow got me off the hook too. I was not an exhibitionist martial artist. Even my critics had to admit that. Kids should not be scrapping with Will Berkeley because just look at those pictures of him in the paper. His form is perfect. It sounds crazy but I found a way to lock into the Earth when I hit from the ground. I think it is actually physics. My position was just perfect. I was even better in the air. That’s where I really shined. I found a way to climb through it. I had a multiple step process. My first move was to get height. My second move was to climb higher on my invisible stair. Then I got into position. My final move was to let gravity take over. Air Tae Kwon Do. The not so friendly skies. We knock you out and stack you like wood in the back of the bus. We actually don’t feel bad about it. We enjoy it. I don’t think I’ve ever been better physically at anything else. And I probably never will be. So my high water mark in terms of athleticism came early. But containing that athleticism was a full-time job. I blew through three martial arts academies. My mother wisely put me under the thumb of Billy Blanks in about the six grade. This would be the solution and my undoing. Billy is actually in the Tae Kwon Do Hall of Fame. He is fully legit. Back then I would have refused admittance. That’s just the kind of kid that I was. I actually preferred Kung Fu. I’d been doing that since I was a toddler. I had a talent for martial arts weapons too. I terrified my coaches with that. I even went after one of them at one point. This is really late stage when I was completely off the hook. Steve Anderson used to try to beat me with no caution. He was a massive and terrifying guy. He probably had a hundred pounds of muscle on me. So I decided that a pair of tonfas would level the playing field. I backed him right down. Billy laughed at that one. Even he admired my weapons skills. I left everybody in the dust. That’s something that I firmly stand behind. I was way better at weapons than I was at fighting. I was pretty well recognized for fighting on the East Coast. Particularly after I won the entire thing. But nobody could touch me in weapons. I was a self-made grand master at that. I am ambidextrous and a math nerd so you put it together and shove it into a dark kid. And you’re in business. I remember getting busted by Billy because I was training with real throwing stars. It was the final frontier in terms of weapons. Billy absolutely flipped out. Are you going to give me back my throwing stars? That’s all I cared about. Do you know how hard it is to lay your hands on real throwing stars? I had to mail order them from Okinawa. I can sort of reach back and find that kid these days but he’s largely a dark shadow from a bygone era. I contacted the photographer that did all these portraits of me in 1985. It was right before I won the entire East Coast. Kelly wants a photo for Booster to inspire him. Daddy was one hell of a martial artist. We just skip all the dark parts. I’m meeting with the photographer today for lunch in Hull which is quite the symmetry. We moved to Hull when I graduated from Central Junior High. Tae Kwon Do was viewed favorably down in Hull. I was hired to be a bouncer at the Vogue nightclub. One of the owners packed the club with black belts. We would make fun of the bouncers that didn’t have them. Brown belts have to work the door. Red belts are bar backs. Will Berkeley counts the money because we all know his big secret. He’s actually a math nerd. That’s why he’s so good at weapons. Thanks for reading, Will
